issue.title: Upgrade to Bevy 0.16

repository.name: bevy_pipelines_ready
repository.description: Bevy plugin for tracking render pipeline status.

issue.body:
There probably won't be a crates.io release until Bevy 0.16.0 is properly released, but you can use this git branch in the mean time.

```toml
[dependencies.bevy_simple_text_input]
git = "https://github.com/rparrett/bevy_pipelines_ready.git"
branch = "bevy-0.16"
```

body: Push constants need to be gated behind ifdefs on webgpu.

I poked around this but didn't find a good solution. Adding some notes in case they're useful.

I guessed that there are two approaches:

1. The occlusion culling shader should avoid using push constants, or have an alternative method if push constants are not supported.
2. The occlusion culling feature should be disabled if push constants are not supported.

I only looked at the second approach.

Most of the occlusion culling is disabled by default and only enabled if the camera has a `OcclusionCulling` component. However, parts of the pipeline are set up regardless - see `PreprocessPipelines::early_gpu_occlusion_culling_preprocess` and a few other pipelines containing `gpu_occlusion`. I suspect this is what triggers the shader compile errors, but I couldn't quite nail that down.

I tried disabling these pipelines by setting `GpuPreprocessingSupport::max_supported_mode` to `GpuPreprocessingMode::None` (previously it was set to `PreprocessingOnly`). This was enough to get `3d_scene` working, but I don't think it's the right solution as it disables more than just occlusion culling. Maybe it's a fallback if a better fix isn't ready for 0.16.

I suspect a better solution is for `PreprocessPipelines::early_gpu_occlusion_culling_preprocess` and company to only be set up if `GpuPreprocessingSupport::max_supported_mode` is `GpuPreprocessingMode::Culling`. But this needs quite a few changes and I've run out of time for now.

issue.title: Use GpuPreprocessingMode::None if features not supported.

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #18463 

## Solution

The features didn't seem to be getting checked for selecting `GpuPreprocessingMode::None`.

body:
The scene now renders, but (fewer?) errors/warnings are still logged.

```
ERROR crates/bevy_render/src/render_resource/pipeline_cache.rs:1010 failed to process shader:error: failed to build a valid final module: Global variable [14] 'constants' is invalid
   ┌─ crates/bevy_core_pipeline/src/experimental/mip_generation/downsample_depth.wgsl:28:1
   │
28 │ var<push_constant> constants: Constants;
   │ ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ naga::GlobalVariable [14]
   │   = Capability Capabilities(PUSH_CONSTANT) is not supported

The number of storage textures (12) in the Compute stage exceeds the maximum per-stage limit (8).
 - While validating binding counts
 - While validating [BindGroupLayoutDescriptor ""downsample depth bind group layout""]
 - While calling [Device].CreateBindGroupLayout([BindGroupLayoutDescriptor ""downsample depth bind group layout""]).

The number of storage textures (12) in the Compute stage exceeds the maximum per-stage limit (8).
 - While validating binding counts
 - While validating [BindGroupLayoutDescriptor ""downsample multisample depth bind group layout""]
 - While calling [Device].CreateBindGroupLayout([BindGroupLayoutDescriptor ""downsample multisample depth bind group layout""]).
```
Tested cbc023b3bb12108cd68110b59e1a252924ab4dac and rc.3
